summary: This document is an email chain from August 13, 2019, providing updates on interviews conducted by the OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details interviews with MCC staff, reveals failures in protocol (lack of cellmate, missed counts, non-functional cameras), and notes that officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas refused to be interviewed.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Recipient and participant in the email chain discussing the MCC interview updates. He asks specific questions to confirm details about the officers involved.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: The officer who discovered Epstein's body and admitted to not conducting the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. counts. She stated Epstein did not have a cellmate overnight and later stuttered when questioned about it.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Officer who was performing CPR on Epstein when discovered. He stated 'we messed up' and 'we didn't do the counts' regarding the protocol failures. He refused to speak with agents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found dead in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019. The document details the circumstances leading to his death, including the lack of a cellmate and missed checks.

connections.description: Both were MCC officers on duty who discovered Epstein's body and were implicated in failing to conduct required counts and ensure Epstein had a cellmate.
Noel was the officer who reported finding Epstein had hung himself and was responsible for his cell block.
Thomas was performing CPR on Epstein when he was discovered and was responsible for his cell block.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the investigation into Epstein's death and is seeking confirmation about Noel's actions and refusal to interview.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Officer Noel reported he had hung himself. Officers Thomas and a lieutenant performed CPR.

events.title: Cellmate Removed, Protocol Failures
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was moved out for court, and he was not reassigned a new cellmate. Officers failed to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.

events.title: MCC Staff Interviews
events.description: OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted voluntary interviews with multiple MCC employees regarding the events surrounding Epstein's death, revealing systemic failures.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: Epstein did not have a cellmate on the night of his death, contrary to protocol, after his previous cellmate was moved for court.
Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to not conducting the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts, with Thomas stating 'we messed up'.
The camera system in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was held was not working at the time of his death.
Multiple officers and supervisors who should have been aware Epstein was without a cellmate refused to be interviewed by investigators without their union representatives.
Epstein had attempted to make an unrecorded legal phone call days before his death, telling a staff member he was calling his mother.
